author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of markets bright, a tale I sing,
The FTSE hath climbed, on eagle's wing.
When Yanks from feast their gaze did cast,
To reckon rates, afore they're past.

In German lands, a yield doth dwell,
Schatz, it be called, reveals doth tell.
Rise scarce, they say, from current state,
By UniCredit, 'tis ornate.

As metals dance 'pon shifting stage,
Uncertain winds do twist and rage.
Gold's luster dimmed, the fates perplexed,
Yet hope doth brew, in trades unhexed.

feedItems.title: FTSE 100 Rises After Initial Losses as US Traders Return From Holiday
feedItems.description: The FTSE 100 managed to edge higher, recovering from opening losses, with the focus already shifting to Thursday’s BOE rate decision.

feedItems.title: German Two-Year Schatz Yield Unlikely to Rise Much from Current Levels
feedItems.description: The two-year German Schatz yield is trading at around 3.15% after rising roughly 40 basis points this month, aligning with UniCredit Research’s target for the end of September and leaving limited room for further rise.

feedItems.title: Metals Mixed Amid Uncertain Macro Sentiment
feedItems.description: Base metals were mixed with gold a touch lower as the macroeconomic outlook remained uncertain, said Peak Trading Research.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Of Lanxess in strife, a warning dire,
Its shares did tumble, year-end earnings drear,
Their path of M&A now mired in muck,
The goats of fortune wander, out of luck.

In Europe's grasp, with China risks to pare,
A strategy unveiled, yet ties not tear,
Like rabbits cautious, trade they navigate,
The snail of caution slow, but safe their gait.

The dollar stood, with nary a rise or fall,
The Fed held back its rate, a quiet call,
No leaps as dogs nor swiftness as the hare,
Momentum lost, yet steady, like the snail they fare.

feedItems.title: Lanxess Slides on Profit Warning
feedItems.description: Lanxess shares dropped sharply after it downgraded its year-end earnings expectations, with some analysts questioning the success of the chemical company’s M&A strategy.

feedItems.title: Europe Aims to Cut China Risks, Not China Ties
feedItems.description: The European Union is set to release an economic-security strategy aimed largely at reducing the risks in its trade relationship with Beijing.

feedItems.title: Dollar Loses Upward Momentum After Fed Skips Rate Rises
feedItems.description: The dollar was flat in Europe and MUFG Bank said the currency has lost upward momentum after the Fed skipped raising interest rates last week for the first time in more than a year.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
O'er oil seas there lies a trade,
Whence China's central banks persuade,
Yet Europe's prices bear no change,
From cuts foreseen, as but a stage.

In Alibaba's throne doth rise,
A new king seen with loyal eyes,
The Brooklyn Nets' own Joe Tsai,
Replaces Zhang, who waves goodbye.

Beside Stellantis doth Foxconn stand,
To venture forth in equal hand,
And forge the blessed chips they sell,
For cars with volts, their tales to tell.

feedItems.title: Oil Shrugs Off China Rate Cuts
feedItems.description: Oil prices were largely unchanged in Europe, showing little reaction to a rate cut from China’s central bank which was widely expected.

feedItems.title: Alibaba Is Replacing Chairman and CEO Daniel Zhang
feedItems.description: Alibaba is replacing top executive Daniel Zhang by naming company veteran and Brooklyn Nets owner Joe Tsai as the new chairman.

feedItems.title: Stellantis, Foxconn Form Chip Venture
feedItems.description: Stellantis and Foxconn are joining forces to create a new equally-owned business that will sell semiconductors to the automotive industry, particularly for EVs.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
By Odin's hand, a tale I weave,
Of far-off island where banks doth cleave,
New Zealand's shores, an inquiry announced,
Profit and competition, now thrice renounced.

As dragons soar in skies of worth,
In Silicon Valley, a beast giveth birth,
A unicorn rare, in Earth's deep heart,
KoBold Metals, Gates doth start.

Hark! To East, a land of jade,
Where forts of commerce, China made,
Borrowing rates cut, strive for renewal,
Yet uncertain chains, bind the sinew.

feedItems.title: New Zealand Government to Probe Banking Competition
feedItems.description: New Zealand authorities have announced an investigation into profitability and competition in its banking sector amid concerns that lenders have made large profits while customers are managing cost-of-living pressures.

feedItems.title: Silicon Valley's Newest Unicorn Is a Mining Company
feedItems.description: Bill Gates and other tech-industry investors are backing AI-powered startup KoBold Metals.

feedItems.title: China Cuts Borrowing Rates Again in Bid to Juice Recovery
feedItems.description: Economists say that more drastic measures may be needed, with debt and uncertainty continuing to weigh on consumers’ willingness to spend.
